entry.title: Three hardfork-related BIPs
entry.summary: In a message to bitcoin-dev, Peter Todd expressed concern that a world of nodes in large datacenters would make it easy to force the few remaining Bitcoin nodes to follow anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) rules. This led to a question about why mining pools haven't already been required to implement AML/KYC regulations, which would be relatively simple to do.
